file_content.text: If we could but do to the Organas what you did to the Lanars.
My men in the field say word has spread. Collaborating with House Lanar's ruffians earns a swift death.
You have culled their numbers and now fear is in full bloom.
They are on the ash heap of Alderaan's history.
Their rebellion will soon be dust.
Soon to be joined by others.
I had reservations that you could bring down such thorny criminals, but your team's coordination is to be admired.
I had reservations about hiring independents such as yourself, but I see they were unfounded.
I had reservations about Imperial assistance, but I see they were unfounded.
Soon, there will be a new day on Alderaan, a day of Thul supremacy.
You said there was a bounty.
Know that I am true to my word. Your payment is here.
I would avoid spending it in public marketplaces for the next few days. The rabble will be easily inflamed.
But it will be the last embers of a dwindling fire, thanks to you. Farewell.
It was nothing.
I am in your debt. There is, of course, the monetary reward, but that is trifling.
I could not walk tall while these pirate traitors turned the people against me.
But with this Lanar question answered, I see the future, and it is one of Thul supremacy.
Lanar pirates continue to land on our coast. Strike now.
Burn every farmhouse. I want every traitor smoked out, every sympathizer weeping -- we'll finish this later. Dismissed.
Yes, my lord.
Ah, welcome to Alderaan. I'm Duke Keldas of the Vibaran Thuls. You've eaten, I trust? Seen the palace, hunted some game?
But that's not why you're here. The Moff sent word of your coming -- I imagine the question of the Lanar pirates came up.
But that's not why you're here. I imagine the question of House Lanar's pirates has come up, and you want an answer.
Naturally, I am interested to hear your version of the events.
[Bluff] Of course.
A shrewd and... diplomatic answer.
You seem awfully eager to talk.
It has now.
I just assumed... the pirates have been on the news holos, the people support them... let me start fresh.
You're mistaken.
Apologies. Dealing with these vermin is like wrestling a muskboar. Even if you win, everyone can smell them on you.
When House Thul returned to Alderaan, our vassal house Lanar turned on us. We had to... sanction their leaders.
But the Lanars became martyrs, and their house soldiers turned to piracy. Their attacks earned them a reputation for... heroism.
Heroes can die. The hope of the rabble will follow.
I can put an end to that.
Overconfidence was the downfall of three of my ships. We no longer attack them at sea.
Tell me what I must do.
The Lanar pirates live at sea, and their land-based contacts are experts at smuggling supplies to them.
How effective has this uprising been?
Are you losing much?
They have scuttled our ships, looted a few million credits' worth of goods--on top of what we've lost trying to catch them.
I've put a sizeable bounty on the pirates and doubled it for the populist traitors who coordinate them from the land.
Yet the people, even the starving ones, refuse to do the honorable thing and alert us to the meeting places.
Then my victory will be all the more demoralizing to them.
They will fall before me.
Your confidence does you credit.
If a fugitive was sipping tea in your palace vault, I'd still sniff him out.
They can't hide from me.
Given how elusive these so-called heroes are, that's not such a stretch.
Your house has a new ally, Duke Keldas.
I will aid you.
And I could not find a finer one in all of known space. To work, then.
Our intelligence says the Lanars come ashore on the beach not far from here.
No doubt they will be lying in wait for a target.
Forget it. [Refuse quest]
I see. I had hoped for more, but no matter.
These are ducal matters. You may leave.
